abstract.p: Nancy Coffin letter takes issue with Omer Bartov's August 6 review of Norman G Finkelstein's book The Holocaust Industry (S)

block.p: Having just finished reading Norman G. Finkelstein's book ''The Holocaust Industry,'' I must object to the ugly and offensive characterizations of the work and its author made by Omer Bartov (Aug. 6).

Whereas Finkelstein's study is exhaustively researched and footnoted, and has been written in a precise and judicious style, Bartov dismisses the book as ''a novel variation on . . . 'The Protocols of the Elders of Zion' ''and, moreover, as ''indecent . . . juvenile, self-righteous, arrogant and stupid.'' This rhetoric demonstrates clearly which of these two writers is engaging in the ''shrill hyperbole'' and ''reckless and ruthless . . . attacks'' that Bartov ascribes to Finkelstein.
